title.value: Unravelling the neural dynamics of hypnotic susceptibility: Aperiodic neural activity as a central feature of hypnosis
title.justification: The provided text clearly states the title of the paper.
title.quote:
Title
Unravelling the neural dynamics of hypnotic susceptibility: Aperiodic neural activity as a central feature of hypnosis

extractions.description: The study uses multivariate statistics and machine learning to investigate the neural dynamics behind individual differences in hypnotic susceptibility by analyzing resting-state electroencephalography (EEG) data.

type.justification: The study involves experimental data collection from participants using EEG recordings before and after hypnotic induction and applies machine learning for analysis.
type.quote: The current work leveraged multivariate statistics and machine learning to probe the neural dynamics underlying inter-individual differences in hypnotic susceptibility.

name.justification: The research focuses on neural activity and brain dynamics related to hypnotic susceptibility.
name.quote: Our approach therefore examines both the pre-induction period and the effect of the induction procedure...We hypothesize that numerous neural attributes inherent to rs-EEG exhibit direct relevance to our focal variables.

name.justification: Machine learning techniques are used to differentiate between high and low hypnotic susceptible individuals.
name.quote: The current work leveraged multivariate statistics and machine learning to probe the neural dynamics underlying inter-individual differences in hypnotic susceptibility.

name.justification: The study explores cognitive functions like hypnotic susceptibility and their neural underpinnings using EEG.
name.quote: Susceptibility to hypnotic suggestions refers to a stable psychological trait that primarily signifies the ability to effectively respond to direct verbal suggestions within controlled and standardized settings.

name.justification: The study uses linear SVM for classifying individuals based on EEG data to distinguish high and low hypnotic susceptibility.
name.quote: We employed a multivariate pattern analysis combined with a leave-one-out cross-validation strategy to train and test linear support vector machine (SVM) models.

is_contributed.justification: The linear SVM is utilized as a tool in this study, not introduced as a new model.
is_contributed.quote: We employed a multivariate pattern analysis combined with a leave-one-out cross-validation strategy to train and test linear support vector machine (SVM) models.

is_executed.justification: The study involves executing the linear SVM on EEG data for analysis.
is_executed.quote: multivariate pattern analysis combined with a leave-one-out cross-validation strategy to train and test linear support vector machine (SVM) models.

is_compared.justification: The SVM model's performance is compared to random permutations to assess its significance.
is_compared.quote: The observed classification performance was compared to a surrogate distribution generated from 1000 random permutations.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is cited in the context of discussing the SVM model and its weights.
referenced_paper_title.quote:

Haufe, S., Meinecke, F., Görgen, K., Dähne, S., Haynes, J.-D., Blankertz, B., & Biessmann, F. (2014). On the interpretation of weight vectors of linear models in multivariate neuroimaging. NeuroImage, 87, 96-110.

name.value: High and Low Hypnotic Susceptibility EEG Dataset
name.justification: The study uses EEG data from individuals with high and low hypnotic susceptibility for analysis.
name.quote: For the present study, we focused on neural activity data from 40 individuals...using their HGSHS:A scores. Specifically, we included individuals who scored above 8, indicating high hypnotic susceptibility (HHSIs), and individuals who scored below 4, indicating low hypnotic susceptibility (LHSIs).
